episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of intriguing topics, including the unique privileges of residents in the French town of Evian, a women-only mangrove forest in Indonesia, the historical impact of the last Ice Age on Swiss health, and the peculiar fashion trends during the reign of Charles II.

facts.fact: Everyone in the French town of Evian is allowed unlimited free Evian.
There's a mangrove forest in Indonesia that's actually a womangrove.
Until the early 20th century, Swiss people were routinely being injured by the last ice age.
During the reign of Charles II, women's dressing tables tended to include both face and nipple makeup.
